content: Trying to do n ^ 2 what am I doing wrong?
Ah that was what was missing. yah I think its via a alg structure right? Was confused because you can use * and + without the import
Yeah it's because it goes through docs#monoid (docs#monoid.has_pow) and docs#nat.monoid is defined in data.nat.basic
Ben has marked this topic as resolved.

This used to work in the past (there was a nat.pow in core Lean), but it was really annoying how nat.pow was not definitionally equal to monoid.pow, so after the fork in 2019 we removed it from core.

When I'm doing mathematics I start every file with import tactic and encourage my students to do the same, precisely so they don't keep asking me questions like this. import tactic is a catch-all import which gives you a lot of stuff which you would expect to be there if you're doing mathematics.

Kevin Buzzard said:

import tactic is a catch-all import which gives you a lot of stuff which you would expect to be there if you're doing mathematics.

That's confusing. It sounds like it just imports tactics.

Imports in lean are transitive, so while it does import many tactics it also happens to include a lot of things needed by tactics like norm_num to run, so most things that one would expect to always have available
